module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.AgentListEntry

-- | Represents a single entry in a list of agents. <tt>AgentListEntry</tt>
--   returns an array that contains a list of agents when the
--   <a>ListAgents</a> operation is called.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentListEntry</a> smart constructor.
data AgentListEntry
AgentListEntry' :: Maybe AgentStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AgentListEntry

-- | The status of the agent.
[$sel:status:AgentListEntry'] :: AgentListEntry -> Maybe AgentStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent.
[$sel:agentArn:AgentListEntry'] :: AgentListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the agent.
[$sel:name:AgentListEntry'] :: AgentListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentListEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AgentListEntry'</a>, <a>agentListEntry_status</a> - The
--   status of the agent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentArn:AgentListEntry'</a>, <a>agentListEntry_agentArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AgentListEntry'</a>, <a>agentListEntry_name</a> - The
--   name of the agent.
newAgentListEntry :: AgentListEntry

-- | The status of the agent.
agentListEntry_status :: Lens' AgentListEntry (Maybe AgentStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent.
agentListEntry_agentArn :: Lens' AgentListEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the agent.
agentListEntry_name :: Lens' AgentListEntry (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.Ec2Config

-- | The subnet and the security group that DataSync uses to access target
--   EFS file system. The subnet must have at least one mount target for
--   that file system. The security group that you provide needs to be able
--   to communicate with the security group on the mount target in the
--   subnet specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEc2Config</a> smart constructor.
data Ec2Config
Ec2Config' :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Ec2Config

-- | The ARN of the subnet and the security group that DataSync uses to
--   access the target EFS file system.
[$sel:subnetArn:Ec2Config'] :: Ec2Config -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the security groups that are
--   configured for the Amazon EC2 resource.
[$sel:securityGroupArns:Ec2Config'] :: Ec2Config -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Ec2Config</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetArn:Ec2Config'</a>, <a>ec2Config_subnetArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the subnet and the security group that DataSync uses to access the
--   target EFS file system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupArns:Ec2Config'</a>,
--   <a>ec2Config_securityGroupArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   of the security groups that are configured for the Amazon EC2
--   resource.
newEc2Config :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Ec2Config

-- | The ARN of the subnet and the security group that DataSync uses to
--   access the target EFS file system.
ec2Config_subnetArn :: Lens' Ec2Config Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the security groups that are
--   configured for the Amazon EC2 resource.
ec2Config_securityGroupArns :: Lens' Ec2Config (NonEmpty Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.Ec2Config.Ec2Config
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.Ec2Config.Ec2Config

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.FilterRule

-- | Specifies which files, folders, and objects to include or exclude when
--   transferring files from source to destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilterRule</a> smart constructor.
data FilterRule
FilterRule' :: Maybe FilterType -> Maybe Text -> FilterRule

-- | The type of filter rule to apply. DataSync only supports the
--   SIMPLE_PATTERN rule type.
[$sel:filterType:FilterRule'] :: FilterRule -> Maybe FilterType

-- | A single filter string that consists of the patterns to include or
--   exclude. The patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for
--   example: <tt>/folder1|/folder2</tt>
[$sel:value:FilterRule'] :: FilterRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FilterRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterType:FilterRule'</a>, <a>filterRule_filterType</a> - The
--   type of filter rule to apply. DataSync only supports the
--   SIMPLE_PATTERN rule type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:FilterRule'</a>, <a>filterRule_value</a> - A single
--   filter string that consists of the patterns to include or exclude. The
--   patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for example:
--   <tt>/folder1|/folder2</tt>
newFilterRule :: FilterRule

-- | The type of filter rule to apply. DataSync only supports the
--   SIMPLE_PATTERN rule type.
filterRule_filterType :: Lens' FilterRule (Maybe FilterType)

-- | A single filter string that consists of the patterns to include or
--   exclude. The patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for
--   example: <tt>/folder1|/folder2</tt>
filterRule_value :: Lens' FilterRule (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry

-- | Represents a single entry in a list of locations.
--   <tt>LocationListEntry</tt> returns an array that contains a list of
--   locations when the <a>ListLocations</a> operation is called.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLocationListEntry</a> smart constructor.
data LocationListEntry
LocationListEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> LocationListEntry

-- | Represents a list of URLs of a location. <tt>LocationUri</tt> returns
--   an array that contains a list of locations when the
--   <a>ListLocations</a> operation is called.
--   
--   Format: <tt>TYPE://GLOBAL_ID/SUBDIR</tt>.
--   
--   TYPE designates the type of location. Valid values: NFS | EFS | S3.
--   
--   GLOBAL_ID is the globally unique identifier of the resource that backs
--   the location. An example for EFS is <tt>us-east-2.fs-abcd1234</tt>. An
--   example for Amazon S3 is the bucket name, such as <tt>myBucket</tt>.
--   An example for NFS is a valid IPv4 address or a host name compliant
--   with Domain Name Service (DNS).
--   
--   SUBDIR is a valid file system path, delimited by forward slashes as is
--   the *nix convention. For NFS and Amazon EFS, it's the export path to
--   mount the location. For Amazon S3, it's the prefix path that you mount
--   to and treat as the root of the location.
[$sel:locationUri:LocationListEntry'] :: LocationListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the location. For Network File
--   System (NFS) or Amazon EFS, the location is the export path. For
--   Amazon S3, the location is the prefix path that you want to mount and
--   use as the root of the location.
[$sel:locationArn:LocationListEntry'] :: LocationListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LocationListEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationUri:LocationListEntry'</a>,
--   <a>locationListEntry_locationUri</a> - Represents a list of URLs of a
--   location. <tt>LocationUri</tt> returns an array that contains a list
--   of locations when the <a>ListLocations</a> operation is called.
--   
--   Format: <tt>TYPE://GLOBAL_ID/SUBDIR</tt>.
--   
--   TYPE designates the type of location. Valid values: NFS | EFS | S3.
--   
--   GLOBAL_ID is the globally unique identifier of the resource that backs
--   the location. An example for EFS is <tt>us-east-2.fs-abcd1234</tt>. An
--   example for Amazon S3 is the bucket name, such as <tt>myBucket</tt>.
--   An example for NFS is a valid IPv4 address or a host name compliant
--   with Domain Name Service (DNS).
--   
--   SUBDIR is a valid file system path, delimited by forward slashes as is
--   the *nix convention. For NFS and Amazon EFS, it's the export path to
--   mount the location. For Amazon S3, it's the prefix path that you mount
--   to and treat as the root of the location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationArn:LocationListEntry'</a>,
--   <a>locationListEntry_locationArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the location. For Network File System (NFS) or Amazon EFS, the
--   location is the export path. For Amazon S3, the location is the prefix
--   path that you want to mount and use as the root of the location.
newLocationListEntry :: LocationListEntry

-- | Represents a list of URLs of a location. <tt>LocationUri</tt> returns
--   an array that contains a list of locations when the
--   <a>ListLocations</a> operation is called.
--   
--   Format: <tt>TYPE://GLOBAL_ID/SUBDIR</tt>.
--   
--   TYPE designates the type of location. Valid values: NFS | EFS | S3.
--   
--   GLOBAL_ID is the globally unique identifier of the resource that backs
--   the location. An example for EFS is <tt>us-east-2.fs-abcd1234</tt>. An
--   example for Amazon S3 is the bucket name, such as <tt>myBucket</tt>.
--   An example for NFS is a valid IPv4 address or a host name compliant
--   with Domain Name Service (DNS).
--   
--   SUBDIR is a valid file system path, delimited by forward slashes as is
--   the *nix convention. For NFS and Amazon EFS, it's the export path to
--   mount the location. For Amazon S3, it's the prefix path that you mount
--   to and treat as the root of the location.
locationListEntry_locationUri :: Lens' LocationListEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the location. For Network File
--   System (NFS) or Amazon EFS, the location is the export path. For
--   Amazon S3, the location is the prefix path that you want to mount and
--   use as the root of the location.
locationListEntry_locationArn :: Lens' LocationListEntry (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationListEntry.LocationListEntry

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LogLevel.LogLevel

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions

-- | Represents the mount options that are available for DataSync to access
--   an NFS location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNfsMountOptions</a> smart constructor.
data NfsMountOptions
NfsMountOptions' :: Maybe NfsVersion -> NfsMountOptions

-- | The specific NFS version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   NFS share. If the server refuses to use the version specified, the
--   sync will fail. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the NFS server.
--   
--   You can specify the following NFS versions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv3</a></b> - stateless protocol version that allows for
--   asynchronous writes on the server.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.0</a></b> - stateful, firewall-friendly protocol
--   version that supports delegations and pseudo filesystems.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.1</a></b> - stateful protocol version that supports
--   sessions, directory delegations, and parallel data processing. Version
--   4.1 also includes all features available in version 4.0.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:NfsMountOptions'] :: NfsMountOptions -> Maybe NfsVersion

-- | Create a value of <a>NfsMountOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:NfsMountOptions'</a>, <a>nfsMountOptions_version</a> -
--   The specific NFS version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   NFS share. If the server refuses to use the version specified, the
--   sync will fail. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the NFS server.
--   
--   You can specify the following NFS versions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv3</a></b> - stateless protocol version that allows for
--   asynchronous writes on the server.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.0</a></b> - stateful, firewall-friendly protocol
--   version that supports delegations and pseudo filesystems.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.1</a></b> - stateful protocol version that supports
--   sessions, directory delegations, and parallel data processing. Version
--   4.1 also includes all features available in version 4.0.</li>
--   </ul>
newNfsMountOptions :: NfsMountOptions

-- | The specific NFS version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   NFS share. If the server refuses to use the version specified, the
--   sync will fail. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the NFS server.
--   
--   You can specify the following NFS versions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv3</a></b> - stateless protocol version that allows for
--   asynchronous writes on the server.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.0</a></b> - stateful, firewall-friendly protocol
--   version that supports delegations and pseudo filesystems.</li>
--   <li><b><a>NFSv4.1</a></b> - stateful protocol version that supports
--   sessions, directory delegations, and parallel data processing. Version
--   4.1 also includes all features available in version 4.0.</li>
--   </ul>
nfsMountOptions_version :: Lens' NfsMountOptions (Maybe NfsVersion)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.NfsMountOptions.NfsMountOptions

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig

-- | A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of agents to use for a Network
--   File System (NFS) location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnPremConfig</a> smart constructor.
data OnPremConfig
OnPremConfig' :: NonEmpty Text -> OnPremConfig

-- | ARNs of the agents to use for an NFS location.
[$sel:agentArns:OnPremConfig'] :: OnPremConfig -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OnPremConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentArns:OnPremConfig'</a>, <a>onPremConfig_agentArns</a> -
--   ARNs of the agents to use for an NFS location.
newOnPremConfig :: NonEmpty Text -> OnPremConfig

-- | ARNs of the agents to use for an NFS location.
onPremConfig_agentArns :: Lens' OnPremConfig (NonEmpty Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.OnPremConfig.OnPremConfig

pattern Operator_LessThanOrEqual :: Operator
pattern Operator_NotContains :: Operator
pattern Operator_NotEquals :: Operator

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter

-- | You can use API filters to narrow down the list of resources returned
--   by <tt>ListLocations</tt>. For example, to retrieve all your Amazon S3
--   locations, you can use <tt>ListLocations</tt> with filter name
--   <tt>LocationType S3</tt> and <tt>Operator Equals</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLocationFilter</a> smart constructor.
data LocationFilter
LocationFilter' :: LocationFilterName -> [Text] -> Operator -> LocationFilter

-- | The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of
--   filters that are available for it (for example, <tt>LocationType</tt>
--   for <tt>ListLocations</tt>).
[$sel:name:LocationFilter'] :: LocationFilter -> LocationFilterName

-- | The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to
--   display only Amazon S3 locations.
[$sel:values:LocationFilter'] :: LocationFilter -> [Text]

-- | The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
[$sel:operator:LocationFilter'] :: LocationFilter -> Operator

-- | Create a value of <a>LocationFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LocationFilter'</a>, <a>locationFilter_name</a> - The
--   name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of
--   filters that are available for it (for example, <tt>LocationType</tt>
--   for <tt>ListLocations</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:LocationFilter'</a>, <a>locationFilter_values</a> - The
--   values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to
--   display only Amazon S3 locations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:LocationFilter'</a>, <a>locationFilter_operator</a> -
--   The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
newLocationFilter :: LocationFilterName -> Operator -> LocationFilter

-- | The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of
--   filters that are available for it (for example, <tt>LocationType</tt>
--   for <tt>ListLocations</tt>).
locationFilter_name :: Lens' LocationFilter LocationFilterName

-- | The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to
--   display only Amazon S3 locations.
locationFilter_values :: Lens' LocationFilter [Text]

-- | The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
locationFilter_operator :: Lens' LocationFilter Operator
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.LocationFilter.LocationFilter

instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PreserveDeletedFiles.PreserveDeletedFiles

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig

-- | The VPC endpoint, subnet, and security group that an agent uses to
--   access IP addresses in a VPC (Virtual Private Cloud).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPrivateLinkConfig</a> smart constructor.
data PrivateLinkConfig
PrivateLinkConfig' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PrivateLinkConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the security groups that are
--   configured for the EC2 resource that hosts an agent activated in a VPC
--   or an agent that has access to a VPC endpoint.
[$sel:securityGroupArns:PrivateLinkConfig'] :: PrivateLinkConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the subnets that are configured
--   for an agent activated in a VPC or an agent that has access to a VPC
--   endpoint.
[$sel:subnetArns:PrivateLinkConfig'] :: PrivateLinkConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The private endpoint that is configured for an agent that has access
--   to IP addresses in a <a>PrivateLink</a>. An agent that is configured
--   with this endpoint will not be accessible over the public internet.
[$sel:privateLinkEndpoint:PrivateLinkConfig'] :: PrivateLinkConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the VPC endpoint that is configured for an agent. An agent
--   that is configured with a VPC endpoint will not be accessible over the
--   public internet.
[$sel:vpcEndpointId:PrivateLinkConfig'] :: PrivateLinkConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PrivateLinkConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupArns:PrivateLinkConfig'</a>,
--   <a>privateLinkConfig_securityGroupArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) of the security groups that are configured for the EC2 resource
--   that hosts an agent activated in a VPC or an agent that has access to
--   a VPC endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetArns:PrivateLinkConfig'</a>,
--   <a>privateLinkConfig_subnetArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   of the subnets that are configured for an agent activated in a VPC or
--   an agent that has access to a VPC endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateLinkEndpoint:PrivateLinkConfig'</a>,
--   <a>privateLinkConfig_privateLinkEndpoint</a> - The private endpoint
--   that is configured for an agent that has access to IP addresses in a
--   <a>PrivateLink</a>. An agent that is configured with this endpoint
--   will not be accessible over the public internet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcEndpointId:PrivateLinkConfig'</a>,
--   <a>privateLinkConfig_vpcEndpointId</a> - The ID of the VPC endpoint
--   that is configured for an agent. An agent that is configured with a
--   VPC endpoint will not be accessible over the public internet.
newPrivateLinkConfig :: PrivateLinkConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the security groups that are
--   configured for the EC2 resource that hosts an agent activated in a VPC
--   or an agent that has access to a VPC endpoint.
privateLinkConfig_securityGroupArns :: Lens' PrivateLinkConfig (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the subnets that are configured
--   for an agent activated in a VPC or an agent that has access to a VPC
--   endpoint.
privateLinkConfig_subnetArns :: Lens' PrivateLinkConfig (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The private endpoint that is configured for an agent that has access
--   to IP addresses in a <a>PrivateLink</a>. An agent that is configured
--   with this endpoint will not be accessible over the public internet.
privateLinkConfig_privateLinkEndpoint :: Lens' PrivateLinkConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the VPC endpoint that is configured for an agent. An agent
--   that is configured with a VPC endpoint will not be accessible over the
--   public internet.
privateLinkConfig_vpcEndpointId :: Lens' PrivateLinkConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkConfig


module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that is used to access an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   For detailed information about using such a role, see Creating a
--   Location for Amazon S3 in the <i>DataSync User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Config</a> smart constructor.
data S3Config
S3Config' :: Text -> S3Config

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket to access. This bucket is used as a parameter in
--   the <a>CreateLocationS3</a> operation.
[$sel:bucketAccessRoleArn:S3Config'] :: S3Config -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Config</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketAccessRoleArn:S3Config'</a>,
--   <a>s3Config_bucketAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket to access.
--   This bucket is used as a parameter in the <a>CreateLocationS3</a>
--   operation.
newS3Config :: Text -> S3Config

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket to access. This bucket is used as a parameter in
--   the <a>CreateLocationS3</a> operation.
s3Config_bucketAccessRoleArn :: Lens' S3Config Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.S3Config.S3Config

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions

-- | Represents the mount options that are available for DataSync to access
--   an SMB location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSmbMountOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SmbMountOptions
SmbMountOptions' :: Maybe SmbVersion -> SmbMountOptions

-- | The specific SMB version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   SMB share. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the SMB server.
[$sel:version:SmbMountOptions'] :: SmbMountOptions -> Maybe SmbVersion

-- | Create a value of <a>SmbMountOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SmbMountOptions'</a>, <a>smbMountOptions_version</a> -
--   The specific SMB version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   SMB share. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the SMB server.
newSmbMountOptions :: SmbMountOptions

-- | The specific SMB version that you want DataSync to use to mount your
--   SMB share. If you don't specify a version, DataSync defaults to
--   <tt>AUTOMATIC</tt>. That is, DataSync automatically selects a version
--   based on negotiation with the SMB server.
smbMountOptions_version :: Lens' SmbMountOptions (Maybe SmbVersion)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.SmbMountOptions.SmbMountOptions


module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry

-- | Represents a single entry in a list of AWS resource tags.
--   <tt>TagListEntry</tt> returns an array that contains a list of tasks
--   when the <a>ListTagsForResource</a> operation is called.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagListEntry</a> smart constructor.
data TagListEntry
TagListEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> TagListEntry

-- | The value for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
[$sel:value:TagListEntry'] :: TagListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The key for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
[$sel:key:TagListEntry'] :: TagListEntry -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagListEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TagListEntry'</a>, <a>tagListEntry_value</a> - The value
--   for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagListEntry'</a>, <a>tagListEntry_key</a> - The key for
--   an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
newTagListEntry :: Text -> TagListEntry

-- | The value for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
tagListEntry_value :: Lens' TagListEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The key for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.
tagListEntry_key :: Lens' TagListEntry Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TagListEntry.TagListEntry


module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail

-- | Describes the detailed result of a <tt>TaskExecution</tt> operation.
--   This result includes the time in milliseconds spent in each phase, the
--   status of the task execution, and the errors encountered.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskExecutionResultDetail</a> smart constructor.
data TaskExecutionResultDetail
TaskExecutionResultDetail' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe PhaseStatus -> Maybe PhaseStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe PhaseStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> TaskExecutionResultDetail

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the PREPARING
--   phase.
[$sel:prepareDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Natural

-- | The status of the PREPARING phase.
[$sel:prepareStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe PhaseStatus

-- | The status of the VERIFYING phase.
[$sel:verifyStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe PhaseStatus

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the VERIFYING
--   phase.
[$sel:verifyDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Natural

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync took to transfer the file
--   from the source to the destination location.
[$sel:totalDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Natural

-- | The status of the TRANSFERRING phase.
[$sel:transferStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe PhaseStatus

-- | Errors that DataSync encountered during execution of the task. You can
--   use this error code to help troubleshoot issues.
[$sel:errorCode:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the TRANSFERRING
--   phase.
[$sel:transferDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Natural

-- | Detailed description of an error that was encountered during the task
--   execution. You can use this information to help troubleshoot issues.
[$sel:errorDetail:TaskExecutionResultDetail'] :: TaskExecutionResultDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskExecutionResultDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prepareDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_prepareDuration</a> - The total time in
--   milliseconds that DataSync spent in the PREPARING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prepareStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_prepareStatus</a> - The status of the
--   PREPARING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verifyStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_verifyStatus</a> - The status of the
--   VERIFYING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verifyDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_verifyDuration</a> - The total time in
--   milliseconds that DataSync spent in the VERIFYING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_totalDuration</a> - The total time in
--   milliseconds that DataSync took to transfer the file from the source
--   to the destination location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferStatus:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_transferStatus</a> - The status of the
--   TRANSFERRING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_errorCode</a> - Errors that DataSync
--   encountered during execution of the task. You can use this error code
--   to help troubleshoot issues.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferDuration:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_transferDuration</a> - The total time in
--   milliseconds that DataSync spent in the TRANSFERRING phase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorDetail:TaskExecutionResultDetail'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionResultDetail_errorDetail</a> - Detailed description of
--   an error that was encountered during the task execution. You can use
--   this information to help troubleshoot issues.
newTaskExecutionResultDetail :: TaskExecutionResultDetail

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the PREPARING
--   phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_prepareDuration :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Natural)

-- | The status of the PREPARING phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_prepareStatus :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe PhaseStatus)

-- | The status of the VERIFYING phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_verifyStatus :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe PhaseStatus)

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the VERIFYING
--   phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_verifyDuration :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Natural)

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync took to transfer the file
--   from the source to the destination location.
taskExecutionResultDetail_totalDuration :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Natural)

-- | The status of the TRANSFERRING phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_transferStatus :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe PhaseStatus)

-- | Errors that DataSync encountered during execution of the task. You can
--   use this error code to help troubleshoot issues.
taskExecutionResultDetail_errorCode :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The total time in milliseconds that DataSync spent in the TRANSFERRING
--   phase.
taskExecutionResultDetail_transferDuration :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Natural)

-- | Detailed description of an error that was encountered during the task
--   execution. You can use this information to help troubleshoot issues.
taskExecutionResultDetail_errorDetail :: Lens' TaskExecutionResultDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TaskExecutionResultDetail

[fromTaskExecutionStatus] :: TaskExecutionStatus -> Text

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionListEntry

-- | Represents a single entry in a list of task executions.
--   <tt>TaskExecutionListEntry</tt> returns an array that contains a list
--   of specific invocations of a task when the <a>ListTaskExecutions</a>
--   operation is called.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskExecutionListEntry</a> smart constructor.
data TaskExecutionListEntry
TaskExecutionListEntry' :: Maybe TaskExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> TaskExecutionListEntry

-- | The status of a task execution.
[$sel:status:TaskExecutionListEntry'] :: TaskExecutionListEntry -> Maybe TaskExecutionStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that was executed.
[$sel:taskExecutionArn:TaskExecutionListEntry'] :: TaskExecutionListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskExecutionListEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TaskExecutionListEntry'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionListEntry_status</a> - The status of a task execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskExecutionArn:TaskExecutionListEntry'</a>,
--   <a>taskExecutionListEntry_taskExecutionArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the task that was executed.
newTaskExecutionListEntry :: TaskExecutionListEntry

-- | The status of a task execution.
taskExecutionListEntry_status :: Lens' TaskExecutionListEntry (Maybe TaskExecutionStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that was executed.
taskExecutionListEntry_taskExecutionArn :: Lens' TaskExecutionListEntry (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskExecutionListEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskExecutionListEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskExecutionListEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskExecutionListEntry

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter

-- | You can use API filters to narrow down the list of resources returned
--   by <tt>ListTasks</tt>. For example, to retrieve all tasks on a source
--   location, you can use <tt>ListTasks</tt> with filter name
--   <tt>LocationId</tt> and <tt>Operator Equals</tt> with the ARN for the
--   location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TaskFilter
TaskFilter' :: TaskFilterName -> [Text] -> Operator -> TaskFilter

-- | The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of
--   filters that are available for it. For example, <tt>LocationId</tt>
--   for <tt>ListTasks</tt>.
[$sel:name:TaskFilter'] :: TaskFilter -> TaskFilterName

-- | The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to
--   display only tasks for a specific destination location.
[$sel:values:TaskFilter'] :: TaskFilter -> [Text]

-- | The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
[$sel:operator:TaskFilter'] :: TaskFilter -> Operator

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TaskFilter'</a>, <a>taskFilter_name</a> - The name of the
--   filter being used. Each API call supports a list of filters that are
--   available for it. For example, <tt>LocationId</tt> for
--   <tt>ListTasks</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:TaskFilter'</a>, <a>taskFilter_values</a> - The values
--   that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to display
--   only tasks for a specific destination location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:TaskFilter'</a>, <a>taskFilter_operator</a> - The
--   operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
newTaskFilter :: TaskFilterName -> Operator -> TaskFilter

-- | The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of
--   filters that are available for it. For example, <tt>LocationId</tt>
--   for <tt>ListTasks</tt>.
taskFilter_name :: Lens' TaskFilter TaskFilterName

-- | The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to
--   display only tasks for a specific destination location.
taskFilter_values :: Lens' TaskFilter [Text]

-- | The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example,
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>Contains</tt>). For more about API filtering
--   operators, see <a>API filters for ListTasks and ListLocations</a>.
taskFilter_operator :: Lens' TaskFilter Operator
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskFilter.TaskFilter

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskSchedule

-- | Specifies the schedule you want your task to use for repeated
--   executions. For more information, see <a>Schedule Expressions for
--   Rules</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data TaskSchedule
TaskSchedule' :: Text -> TaskSchedule

-- | A cron expression that specifies when DataSync initiates a scheduled
--   transfer from a source to a destination location.
[$sel:scheduleExpression:TaskSchedule'] :: TaskSchedule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskSchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:TaskSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>taskSchedule_scheduleExpression</a> - A cron expression that
--   specifies when DataSync initiates a scheduled transfer from a source
--   to a destination location.
newTaskSchedule :: Text -> TaskSchedule

-- | A cron expression that specifies when DataSync initiates a scheduled
--   transfer from a source to a destination location.
taskSchedule_scheduleExpression :: Lens' TaskSchedule Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskSchedule.TaskSchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskSchedule.TaskSchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskSchedule.TaskSchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskSchedule.TaskSchedule

module Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry

-- | Represents a single entry in a list of tasks. <tt>TaskListEntry</tt>
--   returns an array that contains a list of tasks when the
--   <a>ListTasks</a> operation is called. A task includes the source and
--   destination file systems to sync and the options to use for the tasks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskListEntry</a> smart constructor.
data TaskListEntry
TaskListEntry' :: Maybe TaskStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TaskListEntry

-- | The status of the task.
[$sel:status:TaskListEntry'] :: TaskListEntry -> Maybe TaskStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.
[$sel:taskArn:TaskListEntry'] :: TaskListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the task.
[$sel:name:TaskListEntry'] :: TaskListEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskListEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TaskListEntry'</a>, <a>taskListEntry_status</a> - The
--   status of the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskArn:TaskListEntry'</a>, <a>taskListEntry_taskArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TaskListEntry'</a>, <a>taskListEntry_name</a> - The name
--   of the task.
newTaskListEntry :: TaskListEntry

-- | The status of the task.
taskListEntry_status :: Lens' TaskListEntry (Maybe TaskStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.
taskListEntry_taskArn :: Lens' TaskListEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the task.
taskListEntry_name :: Lens' TaskListEntry (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DataSync.Types.TaskListEntry.TaskListEntry
